clinical_study.brief_title: Exploring the Effectiveness of Online Self-help for Parents of Children With Food Allergies
clinical_study.official_title: Exploring the Effectiveness of Online Self-help for Parents of Children With Food Allergies

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to conduct an initial evaluation of whether online self-help can improve the quality of life of parents of children with food allergies.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a pilot randomised controlled trial (RCT) comparing online self-help for parents of children with food allergies with a wait-list control. A battery of self-report measures will be administered online at baseline (week 0), post-intervention (week 5) and at follow-up (week 9).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline at 5-weeks on the Food Allergy Quality of Life Parental Burden scale
primary_outcome.description: This measures parental burden when caring for a food-allergic child, producing a score between 17 and 119, with higher scores indicating greater burden.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline at 9-weeks on the Food Allergy Quality of Life Parental Burden scale
secondary_outcome.description: This measures parental burden when caring for a food-allergic child, producing a score between 17 and 119, with higher scores indicating greater burden.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline at 5-weeks on the Patient Health Questionnaire depression scale 8
secondary_outcome.description: This measures symptoms of depression, producing a score between 0 and 24, with higher scores indicating greater symptomatology.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline at 9-weeks on the Patient Health Questionnaire depression scale 8
secondary_outcome.description: This measures symptoms of depression, producing a score between 0 and 24, with higher scores indicating greater symptomatology.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline at 5-weeks on the Generalised Anxiety Disorder 7 scale
secondary_outcome.description: This measures symptoms of generalised anxiety disorder, producing a score between 0 and 21, with higher scores indicating greater symptomatology.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline at 9-weeks on the Generalised Anxiety Disorder 7 scale
secondary_outcome.description: This measures symptoms of generalised anxiety disorder, producing a score between 0 and 21, with higher scores indicating greater symptomatology.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline at 5-weeks on the Perceived Stress Scale (10 items)
secondary_outcome.description: This produces a score between 0 and 40, with higher scores indicating higher levels of perceived stress.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline at 9-weeks on the Perceived Stress Scale (10 items)
secondary_outcome.description: This produces a score between 0 and 40, with higher scores indicating higher levels of perceived stress.

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline at 5-weeks on the Food Allergy Self-Efficacy Scale for Parents
other_outcome.description: This measures a parent's confidence in managing their child's food allergy, producing a score between 0 and 100, with higher scores indicating greater confidence.

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline at 9-weeks on the Food Allergy Self-Efficacy Scale for Parents
other_outcome.description: This measures a parent's confidence in managing their child's food allergy, producing a score between 0 and 100, with higher scores indicating greater confidence.

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline at 5-weeks on the Intolerance of Uncertainty Scale
other_outcome.description: This measures participants' ability to tolerate uncertainty, producing scores between 27 and 135, with higher scores indicating lower tolerance of uncertainty.

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline at 9-weeks on the Intolerance of Uncertainty Scale
other_outcome.description: This measures participants' ability to tolerate uncertainty, producing scores between 27 and 135, with higher scores indicating lower tolerance of uncertainty.

clinical_study.condition: The Well Being of Parents of Children With Food Allergies

arm_group.description: A website providing information and psycho-education aimed at parents and carers of children with food allergies.
A waiting list control group, who will receive access to the online self-help once the RCT is complete.

intervention.description: As detailed in experimental arm description.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Being a parent of at least one child (under the age of 18) who has a food allergy.
- Adequate understanding of written English.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Having consulted on the design of the self-help website.
